p: Plant parts are frequently used as spices, food additives, and meals. Nkui is a traditional heavily spiced Cameroonian soup, consumed as food and utilized in traditional medicine for nursing mothers. It is made from the combination of different stems and spices including Afrostyrax lepidophyllus Mildbr., Capsicum frutescens Linn., Fagara leprieurii Guill. et Perr., Fagara tessmannii Engl., Mondia whitei Hook. F. Skell., Pentadiplandra brazzeana Baill., Solanum gilo Raddi., Tetrapleura tetraptera Thaub., and Xylopia parviflora A. Rich. Benthane (Tchoupang etÂ al., 2016). Nkui has a rich, distinct, and pleasant flavor, perceived during consumption and attributed to its abundant volatile compounds.
